listitem.para: Based on the fact that you have a running mysql and php (with PEAR and CLI) environment. Also icinga and ido are running you can continue with the second step.
listitem.programlisting: # apt-get install php5-cli php-pear php5-xmlrpc php5-xsl

listitem.para: Get the source and copy icinga-web to a place you like (e.g. /usr/local/icinga-web). You should have a icinga-api too or get one an copy it to you lib path you want
Test the php dependencies. Go to the etc directory and call the phing test script:
All required tests should pass successfully. Maybe you have to alter the php.ini for the framework.
In case of the gpc_magic_quote setting, you have to disable both entries (apache and cli php.ini).
listitem.programlisting:
# vi /etc/php5/apache/php.ini magic_quotes_gpc = off
# vi /etc/php5/cli/php.ini magic_quotes_gpc = off

listitem.para: Create a database and a user you like. The user must have default data privileges like SELECT, UPDATE, INSERT, DELETE. Import the schemes etc/database/deploy/init.sql etc/database/deploy/db-deploy.sql to your database. Thats all

Create a database user with scheme and data privileges (CREATE, DROP, ALTER, INDEX). Go to the etc dir and copy the build.properties to a save place (e.g. /tmp). Alter the database settings within the properties file. You can also set you database root user to create your scheme. Call the phing deploy task:
You have to manually create a database user to access your database. Add the default data privileges that icinga-web can work with the newly created database.
Alter the configfiles:
Change the credentials for your database connection
Go to the appkit.factories section and change the path and the credentials for the icinga-api.
This should be prepared:
* mod_rewrite enabled
* Any htaccess enabled alias settings
Change owner of web directory to http user:
Edit your icinga-web.conf:
Go to the pub directory and changes the .htaccess file. You have to alter the RewriteBase direction to suite your needs.
Clear cache:
Restart your Webserver:
Go to the webpath and try if the webinterface starts without exceptions (database connections web and api). You can login with user 'root' and password 'password'
